meanings.definition: To surpass in finding fault or raising objections.
meanings.sent1: She was always outcaviling her classmates during debates.
meanings.sent2: The customer was outcaviling the salesperson's explanation of the product.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked that the student must have a talent for outcaviling because he found faults in everything.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outcavil others made her the toughest critic in the group.
meanings.sent5: The detective's skill in outcaviling suspects helped solve the case quickly.

meanings.definition: To outdo in quibbling or nitpicking.
meanings.sent1: He was known for outcaviling his colleagues in pointing out small errors.
meanings.sent2: The siblings spent hours outcaviling each other over the rules of their made-up game.
meanings.sent3: The friends laughed as they watched him outcaviling his own arguments in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for outcaviling details made her the go-to person for proofreading.
meanings.sent5: The critic's constant outcaviling of the film's plot left the director frustrated.
